basics.name: Mark Miller
basics.label: Engineer
basics.summary: I am an aerospace engineer with a passion for UAV design, analysis, and fabrication

work.summary: Supervisor overseeing freight flow at site
highlights: Identify and train strong candidates for team lead positions, two promoted to L3 positions
Drive improvements in team efficiency and morale

work.summary: Team member assisting with sort operation
highlights: Trained in leading sort lane under supervision of process assistant
Selected to train new team members in day-to-day operations

volunteer.organization: Senior Capstone Design Project - Supersonic Business Jet
highlights: Performed both subsonic and supersonic aerodynamic calculations for the wing, empennage, and fuselage, performed performance calculations to ensure adherence to the RFP, CFR, and ICAO requirements

volunteer.organization: Independent Study - Tandem Wing Segment Wind Tunnel Model
highlights: Designed, built, tested, and presented a wind tunnel model analyzing the feasibility of two wing segments in tandem.
The results were presented at the annual AAAS scientific conference.
Designing a dual aircraft UAS system capable of performing an autonomous in-flight battery transfer.

The design is utilizing custom motors, off-the-self sensors, 3D printed components, electropermanent magnets, a carbon-fibre chassis, and an onboard computer running a ML algorithm to control the aircraft.

awards.title: Eagle Scout
awards.summary: Achieved highest rank in scouting after completing a community service project consisting of constructing a new sign for a community park
